humanum_full_description_en:
Oracle " born " from " Che " from " a ", " Cao under the" " a like shaped the land." The whole word "grass" (ie "å±®") means to grow out of the ground. The original meaning is to give birth and grow.

In the early inscriptions, the inscriptions on the oracle bone inscriptions were inherited. Later, a point was added under the "å±®" to make a pen, and then another point was changed to a horizontal, so the " one " under the "å±®" became " earth ". The structure and meaning of Xiaozhuan are roughly the same, yet the image of "å±®" born from the earth is not lost. "Shuowen": "Sheng, Jinye. Xiangcamusheng was unearthed." Xu Shenxun was born as "Jinye", which should be an extended meaning.

Oracle refers to fertility, "Collection" 34078: "Qi ğ ¦ª (prayer) was born in Gao Di (å¦£) Bing", pointing to Gao Wei Bing to pray for fertility. In addition, Oracle has the term "birth month", which is opposite to "Zyue" and refers to the next month. "Heji" 8648 is: "Birth month and rainy." The word is also used as an adjective, referring to alive, fresh, "Heji" 116 is: "Almost (hu) to pick up a young bird." "Heji" 10270: "Its Only (get) a deer." In addition, Oracle has the word "multiple lives", pronounced "multi-surname", which is the same as the so-called "people" in the classics. One said that "duosheng" should be pronounced "duo nephew", referring to the son of the Zhou clan.

Bronze " sheng " refers to childbirth, the uncle bell: "and [é£Ÿæˆ] the daughter of the father, ğ©¹(ç²¤)sheng hangs (the uncle) the corpse", "ç²¤" is the spoken word, the whole sentence refers to [é£Ÿæˆ] the father The woman gave birth to an uncle. It also refers to occurrence, Zhongshan Kingâ€™s Fanghu: "Fu (only) leads to disasters, and Ku (only) leads to blessings." It also refers to living things, the Chinese Fang Ding: "Wang Hu (hu) returns (feeds) to the king "It means that the king ordered people to give the king a living phoenix bird. "Mencius. "Wanzhangshang": "In the past, there were fish that feed raw fish to the child, and the child is a pond for humans and animals." Another word is used for the moon phase name, Fengmao: "June (only) gives birth to Ba Yimao." " Sheng " refers to life, and Cai Xiangui: "Milu (jue) gives birth to (order) winter (end)", "Yayoi" literature is called "Mixing", that is, there is a full life, and "Ling the end" is a good death the meaning of. The whole sentence is a prayer for a full life. In addition, " sheng " can also be read as " surname ", Xijia plate: "The fowl (only) me (the zhu) Hou Baisheng (surname)."

The Warring States word " birth " refers to childbirth, "Tsinghua Jane II. Years": "For ten and four years, King Li gave birth to King Xuan, and King Xuan came to the throne." It also refers to survival, as opposed to " death ." "Jianyi" Jane 19: "This is not to be deprived of ambition in life, and not to be named in death."

Name meaning
